IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROVIDES STRENGTH-BASED SPECIAL EDUCATION AND MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES TO CHILDREN.
IRS990.MissionDesc: AS ONE OF OHIO'S LARGEST NON-PROFIT AGENCIES COMMITTED TO CHILDREN, PEP PROVIDES SERVICES BOTH DIRECT AND CONSULTATIVE IN NATURE FOR CHILDREN WITH SEVERE MENTAL HEALTH AND BEHAVIORAL CHALLENGES, THEIR FAMILIES AND THE PROFESSIONALS WHO SUPPORT THEM. PEP IS COMMITTED TO UNDERSTANDING AND OVERCOMING THE SIGNIFICANT TRAUMA AND CHRONIC STRESS EXPERIENCED BY MANY OF THE CHILDREN WE SERVE.
IRS990.Desc: DAY TREATMENT CENTERS: POSITIVE EDUCATION PROGRAM'S DAY TREATMENT CENTERS SERVE SCHOOL-AGE CHILDREN AND YOUTH WHO HAVE BEEN DIAGNOSED WITH AN EMOTIONAL DISTURBANCE IN AN INTEGRATED EDUCATIONAL AND MENTAL HEALTH ENVIRONMENT. THESE CENTERS SERVE AS BOTH THE SCHOOL AND THE THERAPEUTIC TREATMENT CENTER FOR THESE CHILDREN AND YOUTH. PEP'S SIX CENTERS ARE LOCATED THROUGHOUT NORTHEAST OHIO AND HAVE THE ABILITY TO SERVE CHILDREN WITH MULTIPLE DISABILITIES. PEP'S DAY TREATMENT CENTERS SERVED 499 CHILDREN FROM 64 SCHOOL DISTRICTS IN 13 COUNTIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: PEP ASSIST: PEP ASSIST IS PEP'S CONSULTATION AND TRAINING ARM, PROVIDES SCHOOLS AND PROGRAMS WITH BEST PRACTICES FOR WORKING WITH AT-RISK AND SPECIAL NEEDS CHILDREN. SERVICES ARE INDIVIDUALLY TAILORED TO MEET THE UNIQUE NEEDS OF EACH DISTRICT. SERVED 122 CHILDREN FROM 14 SCHOOL DISTRICTS IN 4 COUNTIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: CONNECTIONS: POSITIVE EDUCATION PROGRAM'S CONNECTIONS COORDINATES SERVICES FOR SOME OF THE COMMUNITY'S MOST AT-RISK CHILDREN AND YOUTH, ALL OF WHOM ARE EXPERIENCING SEVERE EMOTIONAL DISTURBANCE, ARE INVOLVED WITH SEVERAL OF THE COUNTY'S CHILD-SERVING SYSTEMS, AND ARE AT RISK OF BEING REMOVED FROM THEIR HOME. PEP CONNECTIONS WORKS WITH THE CHILD AND EVERYONE INVOLVED IN HIS/HER LIFE TO CREATE A PLAN OF CARE AIMED AT HELPING THE CHILD ACCESS COMMUNITY SUPPORTS AND BEGIN ON A PATH TO SUCCESS. PEP CONNECTIONS SERVED 621 CHILDREN.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES GENERALLY ACCEPTED IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA REQUIRE MANAGEMENT TO EVALUATE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY PEP AND RECOGNIZE A TAX LIABILITY IF PEP HAS TAKEN CERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT WOULD NOT BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY APPLICABLE TAXING AUTHORITIES. PEP WOULD RECOGNIZE INTEREST AND PENALTIES ACCRUED, IF ANY, RELATED TO UNRECOGNIZED TAX UNCERTAINTIES IN INCOME TAX EXPENSE. MANAGEMENT HAS ANALYZED TAX POSITIONS TAKEN AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT THERE ARE NO MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS TAKEN, OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN, THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION OF A LIABILITY OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART IV, LINE 2 AND SCHEDULE B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NO GRANTS RECEIVED EXCEEDED THE 2% SCHEDULE B REPORTING THRESHOLD.
THE ORGANIZATION HAS 233 EMPLOYEES THAT WORK SPECIFICALLY FOR PEP. THE REMAINING WORKFORCE OF APPROXIMATELY 300 EMPLOYEES IS LEASED THROUGH THE EDUCATIONAL SERVICE CENTER OF CUYAHOGA COUNTY. *

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PEP'S CEO, CFO, AND THE BOARD'S FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEW THE FORM 990 IN DETAIL WITH THE OUTSIDE ACCOUNTANTS. THE FINANCE COMMITTEE MAKES A RECOMMENDATION TO THE FULL BOARD (OR THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE ACTING ON ITS BEHALF) TO APPROVE THE 990. UPON APPROVAL, THE FORM 990 IS FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY, BOARD MEMBERS SIGN A "CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ACKNOWLEDGEMENT & DISCLOSURE STATEMENT." THE CEO ENSURES THAT ALL BOARD MEMBERS SIGN THE DOCUMENT AND SHE REVIEWS EACH DOCUMENT TO DETERMINE IF ANY INTEREST DISCLOSED MAY IMPAIR THE INDEPENDENCE OF THE BOARD MEMBER FOR VOTING PURPOSES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY, THE CEO'S SALARY IS EVALUATED AGAINST COMPARABLE POSITIONS AT OTHER CHILD-SERVING AGENCIES IN THE GREATER CLEVELAND AREA TO DETERMINE REASONABLENESS. IN ADDITION, THE CEO'S SALARY IS EVALUATED ANNUALLY BY COMPARING HER SALARY TO COMPARABLE POSITIONS FOUND IN THE GREATER CLEVELAND SCHOOL SUPERINTENDENTS ASSOCIATION'S ANNUAL SALARY & FRINGE BENEFIT STUDY. THE CEO'S SALARY IS APPROVED BY A VOTE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. ANNUALLY, THE COMPENSATION OF OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES IS EVALUATED AGAINST COMPARABLE POSITIONS AT OTHER CHILD-SERVING AGENCIES IN THE GREATER CLEVELAND AREA TO DETERMINE REASONABLENESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S CURRENT GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CURRENT CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, CURRENT AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND CURRENT FORM 990 ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST DURING NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS. ALL OF THE ORGANIZATION'S FILINGS WITH THE OHIO SECRETARY OF STATE'S OFFICE INCLUDING PEP'S ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION, CERTIFICATION OF CONTINUED EXISTENCE AND STATUTORY AGENT CHANGES CAN ALSO BE OBTAINED FROM OHIO'S SECRETARY OF STATE WEBSITE. IN ADDITION, FORM 990 CAN ALSO BE OBTAINED FROM GUIDESTAR.ORG. FORM 990, PART VII, SECTION A, COLUMN D: FOR CERTAIN INDIVIDUALS, THE COMPENSATION LISTED IN PART VII REFLECTS BOX 1 OF THE W-2 PLUS EMPLOYEE RETIREMENT CONTRIBUTIONS. BOX 5 OF THE W-2 IS NOT REPRESENTATIVE OF SOME EMPLOYEES' TOTAL WAGES DUE TO THEIR EMPLOYMENT STATUS. FORM 990, PART IX, LINE 24A: "WRAP AROUND SERVICES" ARE SPECIALIZED SERVICES PROVIDED FOR CLIENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THEIR "INDIVIDUAL SERVICE PLANS." THESE SERVICES ARE FUNDED THROUGH ADAMHS BOARD OF CUYAHOGA COUNTY AND ARE INTENDED TO "WRAP AROUND" A CLIENT WHO NEEDS MORE THAN JUST A NARROWLY DEFINED MEDICAID MEDICAL SERVICE.
